sect1.title: Third-party Javascript Libraries
sect1.para: Aranea distribution includes some third party Javascript libraries. Most of these are not needed for using Aranea functionality, but extend the functionality of both framework and UiLib.

note.para: Behaviour library was removed since 1.2.1 because it was out-of-date and because Prototype can now do its work. To reduce the scripts on the client-side, it was reasonable to avoid Behaviour.

sect2.title: The DHTML Calendar (http://www.dynarch.com/projects/calendar/)
sect2.para: Nice DHTML calendar, required if one wants to use Aranea JSP <ui:dateInput> or <ui:dateTimeInput> tags.

sect2.title: Prototype (http://www.prototypejs.org/)
sect2.para: Prototype is a JavaScript framework that aims to ease development of dynamic web applications. Aranea partial rendering model uses its XMLHttpRequest facilities for generating requests and defining update callbacks. It is also needed for using Uilib's AutoCompleteTextControl and action-enabled TreeWidget components.

sect2.title: script.aculo.us (http://script.aculo.us/)
sect2.para: script.aculo.us provides easy-to-use, cross-browser user interface JavaScript libraries. Only subset of script.aculo.us libraries are included— JSP tags that depends on them are <ui:autoCompleteTextInput> and <ui:tooltip>.

sect2.title: TinyMCE (http://tinymce.moxiecode.com/)
sect2.para: TinyMCE is a platform independent web based Javascript HTML WYSIWYG editor control. Required for using Aranea JSP <ui:richTextarea> tag.

sect2.title: Prototip (http://www.nickstakenburg.com/projects/prototip/)
sect2.para: Prototip allows to easily create both simple and complex tooltips using the Prototype javascript framework. If one also uses Scriptaculous some nice effects can be added. This is required when using JSP <ui:tooltip> tag.

sect2.title: ModalBox (http://www.wildbit.com/labs/modalbox/)
sect2.para: ModalBox is a JavaScript technique for creating modern modal dialogs or even wizards (sequences of dialogs) without using conventional popups and page reloads.

sect2.title: log4javascript (http://log4javascript.org/)
sect2.para: Note that this is now deprecated in favour of Firebug's built in logging facilities. Logging to Firebug console is enabled with AraneaPage.setFirebugLogger().

log4javascript is a JavaScript logging framework similar to Java logging framework log4j. Include log4javascript scripts and call araneaPage().setDefaultLogger() to receive a popup window where Aranea JS debug output is logged. When Firebug is active, its logging to its console can be activated with AraneaPage.setFirebugLogger().

sect1.title: Aranea Clientside Javascript
sect1.para: Aranea uses javascript to do form submits. The code is sent to the client-side in compressed form. The script enables AJAX enabled webapps and provides more control over form submitting logic. Each page served by Aranea has associated AraneaPage object:

Since Aranea 1.2.2, the JavaScript API also includes submit callback API, which can be used to provide more control over submitting. It contains methods that can be overridden to change or add some some behaviour.
